briefTitle: A Dose Frequency Optimization,Trial of Nivolumab 240 mg Every 2 Weeks vs Nivolumab 480 mg Every 4 Weeks in Subjects With Advanced or Metastatic Non-small Cell Lung Cancer Who Received Up to 12 Months of Nivolumab at 3 mg/kg or 240 mg Every 2 Weeks
officialTitle: A Dose Frequency Optimization, Phase IIIB/IV Trial of Nivolumab 240 mg Every 2 Weeks vs Nivolumab 480 mg Every 4 Weeks in Subjects With Advanced or Metastatic Non-small Cell Lung Cancer Who Received up to 12 Months of Nivolumab at 3 mg/kg or 240 mg Every 2 Weeks
summary: The primary objective of this study is to compare PFS (progression-free survival) rate at 6 months and at 1 year after randomization, of Nivolumab 480 mg every 4 weeks with nivolumab 240 mg every 2 weeks in subjects with advanced/metastatic (Stage IIIb/IV) NSCLC (non-Sq and Sq).

primaryOutcome.measure: Progression Free Survival Rate (PFSR) at 6 Months
